citation.article-title: Streptomyces thermogriseus, a new species of the genus Streptomyces from soil, lake and hot-spring

p.s: Description of Streptomyces thermogriseus sp. nov.
Streptomyces thermogriseus (ther.mo.gri.seus. M.L. adj. therme heat; adj. griseus grey; M.L. thermogriseus heat, grey)
Grey or white aerial hyphae, becoming black after autolysis.
The spores are spherical, subspherical or short rods.
Neither diffusible pigment nor melanin is produced.
Lecithinase may or may not be produced.
Growth or no growth in 7% NaCl.
Utilizes or does not utilize glucose, fructose, xylose, raffinose, ribitol and cellobiose.
No resistance to neomycin and rifampicin.
The cell wall contains L-diaminopimelic acid and glycine.

Strain Y-4027 (= CCTCC AA97012) was isolated from soil samples of Kunming, Y-5114 (= CCTCC AA97013) was from Chenghai Lake, and Y-14046T (= CCTCC AA97014T) and Y-14082 (= CCTCC AA97015) were from a hot-spring in Eryuan, Yunnan, China.
